newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian embassy staff leave Congo Republic.
newsitem.headline: Italian embassy staff leave Congo Republic.

text.p: Italy said on Monday its ambassador and embassy staff had been evacuated by French forces from the Congo Republic because of fighting in the capital Brazzaville.

A Foreign Ministry statement said the zone around the embassy had become a "theatre of violent fighting between rival factions" and Foreign Minister Lamberto Dini had authorised the evacuation of staff to neighbouring Gabon.
"The embassy personnel, 13 people in all, were today evacuated by the French forces who are leaving the country at the end of an operation to evacuate foreigners," it said.
The Italian ambassador, Fausto Pennacchio, moved temporarily to Libreville in Gabon.
French troops have evacuated more than 5,000 foreign nationals caught up in a bloody political and ethnic dispute in its former colony in central Africa.

France is pressing ahead with the withdrawal of its soldiers despite an appeal from Congo President Pascal Lissouba to leave troops in the city as a buffer between the army and militiamen loyal to former military leader Denis Sassou Nguesso.
